Name: Prohibiting the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs in certain locations.
Title: A Local Law to amend the administrative code of the city of New York, in relation to prohibiting the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs in certain locations
BodyName: Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

This Introduction was Referred to Comm by Council to the Committee on Health
This Introduction was Re-referred to Committee by Council to the Committee on Mental Health, Disabilities and Addiction

Attachments.Name: Minutes of the Stated Meeting - May 16, 2024
Int. No. 868-A - Fiscal Impact Statement - City Council
Int. No. 868-A - Fiscal Impact Statement - OMB

Summary: This bill would prohibit the distribution by mobile syringe service programs of hypodermic syringes and needles within any playground; within 50 feet of a playground, where practicable; on any school premises, or adjacent to any school premises.
Text:
Be it enacted by the Council as follows:
      
      
      Section 1. Subdivision a of section 17-180.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, is amended by adding new definitions of "adjacent to any school premises"; "mobile syringe service program"; "playground"; and "school premises" in alphabetical order to read as follows:
      Adjacent to any school premises. The term "adjacent to any school premises" means any sidewalk that directly abuts a school premises.
      Mobile syringe service program. The term "mobile syringe service program" means any person, organization, or entity authorized by the state department of health to distribute hypodermic syringes and needles and operating out of a van, bus, or automobile. 
      Playground. The term "playground" has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-1202.
      School premises. The term "school premises" has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-702.
      � 2. Section 17-180.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision j to read as follows:
      j. Prohibition on the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs in certain locations. A mobile syringe service program shall not distribute hypodermic syringes and needles in the following locations in the city: within any playground; within 50 feet of a playground, where practicable; on any school premises, or adjacent to any school premises.
      � 2. This local law takes effect on the same day that a local law relating to the safe collection and disposal of needles and syringes, as proposed in introduction number 1169-A, takes effect.

Subdivision a of section 17-180.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York, is amended by adding new definitions of \ldblquote adjacent to any school premises\rdblquote ; \ldblquote mobile syringe service program\rdblquote ; \ldblquote playground\rdblquote ; and \ldblquote school premises\rdblquote  in alphabetical order to read as follows:\par
\ul Adjacent to any school premises. The term \ldblquote adjacent to any school premises\rdblquote  means any sidewalk that directly abuts a school premises.\par
Mobile syringe service program. The term \ldblquote mobile syringe service program\rdblquote  means any person, organization, or entity authorized by the state department of health to distribute hypodermic syringes and needles and operating out of a van, bus, or automobile. \par
Playground. The term \ldblquote playground\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-1202.\par
School premises. The term \ldblquote school premises\rdblquote  has the same meaning as set forth in section 17-702.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. Section 17-180.1 of the administrative code of the city of New York is amended by adding a new subdivision j to read as follows:\par
\ul j. Prohibition on the distribution of hypodermic syringes and needles by mobile syringe service programs in certain locations. A mobile syringe service program shall not distribute hypodermic syringes and needles in the following locations in the city: within any playground; within 50 feet of a playground, where practicable; on any school premises, or adjacent to any school premises.\par
\ulnone\'a7 2. This local law takes effect on the same day that a local law relating to the safe collection and disposal of needles and syringes, as proposed in introduction number 1169-A, takes effect.\ul\par
